title: High Carbon Dioxide Net Fluxes from Forest Land
description: In 2022, Uganda recorded a net flux of 43.07 Mt CO2e from forest land, indicating significant carbon dioxide emissions from land use and forestry activities.

title: Low Coverage of Social Protection Programs
description: As of 2016, only 1.52% of Uganda's population was covered by social protection and labor programs, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Low Coverage of Social Safety Net Programs
description: In 2016, just 0.66% of Uganda's population was covered by social safety net programs, highlighting a significant gap in social support.

title: Low Coverage of Social Insurance Programs
description: Only 0.65% of Uganda's population was covered by social insurance programs in 2016, indicating limited access to social insurance.

title: High Treatment of Children with Antimalarial Drugs
description: In 2019, 62.5% of children under age 5 with fever in Uganda received antimalarial drugs, reflecting strong efforts in malaria treatment.

title: Low Prevalence of Female Genital Mutilation
description: Uganda had a low prevalence of female genital mutilation at 0.3% in 2016, showcasing progress in reducing this harmful practice.
